definition: to carry a disease/carrier/vector
band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise
illness/CL:場|场[chang2]/disease/to fall ill/defect
to look unwell

sentences.english: Good, because I don't think my girlfriend would be too happy with sick flowers!
sentences.chinese: 很好，我想我女朋友也不会太喜欢带病的花儿。

sentences.english: Neglected tropical diseases are a symptom of poverty and disadvantage.
sentences.chinese: 热带病被忽视这一现象是贫穷落后的象征。

sentences.english: Dengue is spread through the bite of infected mosquitoes.
sentences.chinese: 登革热是经由带病毒的蚊虫叮咬进行传播的。

sentences.english: The neglected tropical diseases provide another example of our solidarity.
sentences.chinese: 被忽视的热带病是我们团结一致的另一个例子。

sentences.english: She says people showing up at work sick are a much bigger concern than people missing work when they're not really ill.
sentences.chinese: 她说带病上班的人比那些装病请假的人更令人担忧。

sentences.english: The feasibility of sterilizing the soil and cotton seeds infected with cotton wilt fungus was discussed.
sentences.chinese: 讨论了用溴甲烷处理带病土壤和种子的可行性。

sentences.english: The grapevine viruses were serious damage in Lanzhou and some old grapevine area.
sentences.chinese: 兰州地区和一些老的葡萄产区葡萄带病毒病较严重。

sentences.english: Yes, there's a financial price to coming to work ill.
sentences.chinese: 没错，带病上班是有经济代价的，这叫做假性出席。

sentences.english: The ancestors to perform his duties back to the city hall, Confucianism, persuaded him to go home and rest.
sentences.chinese: 继祖带病回市政厅工作，敦儒劝他回家休息。

sentences.english: Health development includes the chronic diseases and the neglected tropical diseases.
sentences.chinese: 卫生发展包括慢性病和被忽视的热带病。

sentences.english: they get sick, infect one another, then bring the disease back home.
sentences.chinese: 他们患病又感染其他人，然后又带病回家。

definition: to fall ill
on time/before deadline/on schedule
to accumulate work causes sickness (idiom); to fall ill from constant overwork
to take time off/to take leave (e.g. for study)/to skive off work
to do one's duty/to do one's bit conscientiously
old illness recurs (idiom); a relapse/fig. to repeat an old error/the same old problem
to recover (from an illness)
to take strict precautions/on your guard
to catch an illness/to get infected with a disease
to catch cold/(common) cold/CL:場|场[chang2],次[ci4]/(coll.) to be interested in (often used in the negative)/(Tw) to detest/can't stand
to delay/to hold up/to waste time/to interfere with
serious illness
to request leave of absence
complete personnel/fully manned
according to regulation
to fall ill/to be stricken with an illness
